title: 820-3115 no post
message:
Macbook had water damage retraced some areas reflowed smc and got it working but had no backlight. After working in backlight for a bit i realized the machine stopped posting.

ppvcore cpu is 1.1v

not sure what happened but last thing i did was replace the led driver thats when it stopped booting

i get no sound with or without ram so it could be cpu isnt engaging?

i checked u7400 area ton resistors are fine and traces are good even replaced u7400 and no luck.

title: 820-3115 no post
message: Water damage around bios chip??? I would try bios first...

title: 820-3115 no post
message: I figured that be it too but i noticed on other machines when its a bios issue the machine will do quarter fan spins not constantly fan spin. I will try replacing tho.

title: 820-3115 no post
message: If MLB has started working after reflowed SMC, I recommend you to remove and reball SMC...

title: 820-3115 no post
message: Reballed smc, checked traces to bios and even replaced bios. Still no change.

title: 820-3115 no post
message:
Reflow PCH too, with good flux.
You still have some issue generated by corrosion...
BTW, did you place U9701 correctly?

title: 820-3115 no post
message: Good flux would be amtech right. Also how long should i heat it for. Im using my quick to reflow

title: 820-3115 no post
message:
30s should be good enough, no more than 200 degrees.
Only need to burn ecentually crap, not to melt the balls.

title: 820-3115 no post
message: that didnt work im deeming this board trash

title: 820-3115 no post
message:
I still suppose to have an issue generated by corrosion.
Maybe RAM slots with problems, or some traces in the board.
Did you try new BIOS with clean ME, just in case?
